channel.title: Uncategorized on noone.dev
channel.description: Recent content in Uncategorized on noone.dev
channel.copyright: Copyright Â© 2019, Kevin Noone; all rights reserved.

item.title: Matchbox Desktop Config
item.description: I’m working on a new project for my PDA. The application will allow for configuring the Matchbox Desktop (which is the user interface for my PDA). Without this application, users of Matchbox (on a PDA anyway) must edit a series of configuration files in order to create folders and move programs from folder to folder. My program allows for adding/editing/deleting applications and folders. It’s written in Python 2.4 using the GTK library for UI.

item.title: iPhone, OpenMoko, HTC Shift
item.description: I’ve been hacking away at my Sharp Zaurus for a couple of years now. It has brought me great pleasure, but I’m in need of a new toy. Anyone’s input is appreciated. At the moment, my options are: iPhone: Pros: It looks nice and does lots of cool stuff (I assume). There will be a large software repository due to it’s popularity. Cons: It’s Apple. I don’t want a machine so tightly coupled with a corporation.

item.title: Web Builder 2.0
item.description: I am in Vegas at the Web Builder 2.0 conference. It is day 1 and I’ve aleady picked up some interesting ideas. The focus is creating rich front-end web applications using tools such as Ajax and web services. Also, I met Pete Rose yesterday!

item.title: Updated Zaurus Screenshots
item.description: I’ve spent quite a bit of time lately configuring my PDA to be just how I like it, from the look-and-feel to the installed applications. Here is the updated page with screenshots.

item.title: Get Motivated
item.description: On Monday, I get to attend a seminar called “Get Motivated,” with speakers including Steve Forbes, Rudoph Giuliani, and General Colin Powell. To boot, I get to use this as training for my job. Details

item.title: Last Harvest
item.description: Summer is over and the colder weather is rolling in, so we picked the last of our tomatos, onions, and peppers. Salsa!

item.title: Beverly Beach
item.description: We went on a nice camping trip to Beverly Beach, in Newport, last weekend. We also explored downtown Newport, going to the “Ripley’s Believe it or Not” museum and the wax museum. Here is a video of the beach, and here are some photos.

item.title: New Toys
item.description: I have 2 fairly new toys that are exciting enough (to me) to write about. One is a 37″ LCD television from Olevia. I got a great deal on it, and we are very happy with it. Unfortunately, we don’t have HD service yet. Soon. The other toy is a mouse for my PDA. The mouse itself isn’t that impressive, but it gives my PDA a laptop feel. I’m currently running Linux with ICEWM as the window manager.

item.title: I am a…
item.description: Materialist 94% Modernist 88% Existentialist 69% Postmodernist 44% Cultural Creative 44% Romanticist 44% Idealist 19% Fundamentalist 6% <p> <a href='http://quizfarm.

item.title: Happy Birthday Bren
item.description: Today is Brenda’s birthday!

item.title: 100+ degrees, part II
item.description: Yesterday (Friday), the temperature reached 104 degrees in the Portland area. Today we’re in for another hot one. Did someone say that global warming is not a concern?

item.title: Small Vacation
New PDA Screenshots
item.description: I’ve updated the software on my Sharp Zaurus PDA, and also updated my screenshots: See screenshots here

item.title: 100+ degrees
item.description: It has reached 100 degrees here in Gresham… in the shade!

item.title: My first Ruby/GTK app
item.description: In experimenting with the GTK widget set (an open source, cross platform user interface library), I’ve produced this little application to search Amazon.com for movie titles. The movies can be saved locally and be printed to make DVD covers, etc. It’s not finished yet. Ruby is the language I’ve chosen for this development.

item.title: Bye Netflix
item.description: I’m no longer using Netflix since I now have Directv with more channels than I know what to do with (including the MLB channels so I can watch the Astros make their way to the World Series again). I replaced the movie section of this page (below, to the right) with a music section, “I’m listening to…”. Here I will link to the artist site and provide 1 full song for download.

item.title: Schmap Portland Guide
item.description: 9 of my flickr photos were chosen to be used for the Schmap Portland Guide. From the Schmap web site: The Schmap Portland Guide comes with dynamic maps, useful links, playable tours, top picks, plus photos and reviews for 100s of sights and attractions, hotels, restaurants, theaters, museums…

item.title: G-town
item.description: I’ve officially moved to Gresham (see garden photos –>), and we are busily unpacking and getting organized. Garage sale coming soon.

item.title: Funny Installation Message
item.description: This is an actual screenshot from an installation program for my usb device server:

item.title: Some Weekend Fun
item.description:
Check out many photos from the family visit to PDX. They are on my flickr page.
I’ve been on call all weekend – no fun. This weekend, however, I’m going to see the Round Rock Express vs. Portland Beavers (baseball) at PGE Park.

item.title: A Ruby Project (finally)
item.description: I have finally published some Ruby code that I’ve been playing around with. It’s nothing big, but I’m still learning. See the ruby [on rails] page.

item.title: Hometown Tourism
item.description: We had a delightful time last weekend with my parents and aunt and uncle. Our activities included: Multnomah Falls, Mt. Hood, Vista House, Mt. St. Helens, Japanese Garden, Council Crest, Saturday Market, and the Farmer’s Market. Photos coming real soon…

item.title: VNC on the PDA
item.description: I was able to VNC (Virtual Network Computing) from my PDA, running linux, to my Windows 2000 server. It’s very cool. Here’s a screenshot (click thumbnail):

item.title: Kohl’s
item.description: Kohl’s had a grand opening sale today in Gresham. I’ve never been to a Kohl’s before and now I know where I’ll be buying most of my clothing. Their stuff is insanely cheap, and high quality (brand names). Today, I bought 15 pairs of black socks for about $18 total! I’ll be disposing of my current inventory of socks and I’ll never have to match them up again – because my 15 pairs are all exactly the same!

item.title: New PDA
item.description: I bought a new linux-based PDA last week. This one is the Sharp SL-C1000. It has a 640×480 screen and a full qwerty keyboard. It’s basically a tiny laptop. Screenshots

item.title: St. Patrick’s Day
item.description: We will be going to the Bucket Brigade Cafe & Ale House (pictured above) this evening to celebrate St. Patrick’s Day.

item.title: Anti-pattern
item.description: This is an interesting read about anti-patterns as they apply to programming and other facets of IT.

item.title: PDX Shows
item.description: A new flickr group focused on live music in Portland has been started.

item.title: March Snow
item.description: It snowed again last night. We thought Spring was around the corner, but it’s not quite here yet. KATU News This isn’t weather-related, but some friends of a friend got a cool write-up in this week’s Willamette Week. Jackmove. Read it here.

item.title: Kevin
item.description: This is my name in Japanese, according to Lexiquetos.

item.title: Mariners vs. Beavers
item.description: I will be seeing the Seattle Mariners play the Portland Beavers here at PGE Park on March 31. “Popular major league club travels to Portland to face 2006 edition of hometown Portland Beavers.”

item.title: Home and Garden
item.description: I survived the Portland Home and Garden Show today.

item.title: This is Me
item.description: This is me. I didn’t get photos from Bridgeport, but I did upload some of me doing handyman work. see them on flickr.

item.title: New Eyes
item.description: My new eye glasses have arrived. How do I look? Actually, that’s Elvis Costello. I’ll get a photo of myself in the near future. We’re going to the grand re-opening of the Bridgeport Brewpub and Bakery this evening. Maybe I’ll take some photos there.

item.title: Teeth
item.description: I had my teeth cleaned today, for the first time in… a while. I stand by my theory that the number of visits to the dentist is proportional to the number of tooth problems one has (the theory is not unfounded). I’m thinking once every 18 months is often enough for cleaning.

item.title: Rubbernecking
item.description: Rubbernecking is where drivers slow down to look at recent collisions or anything out of the ordinary on the highway. No one likes a rubbernecker, so why does everyone do it?

item.title: Popsicles
item.description: We are all popsicles in Portland. Not only is it freezing, but the winds are blowing “pretty good”. wunderground.com

item.title: February Snow
item.description: We got a little bit of snow in Lake Oswego last night, and more is forecast for this weekend. I guess spring isn’t quite here yet.

item.title: Squirrel
item.description: Squirrels in Gresham are friendly. We took a nice walk on the Springwater Corridor Trail on Sunday.

item.title: Spring Cleaning, Valentine’s, and Fake Meat
item.description: We took some old computer hardware to Free Geek today. Bren had an old school Tandy and a dot matrix printer stored away in the closet. I meant to take photos, in case the computer museum needed them, but I forgot. Meanwhile, I received a fabulous Valentine’s Day present today (early, I know) – a Creative Zen Micro 6gb mp3 player! Very nice, very nice. And if that isn’t enough, we just ate stuffed bellpeppers made with fake ground meat.

item.title: Or… Drew Carey
item.description: I’m thinking that I’ll look more like Drew Carey when I get my new glasses. I’d never wear a suit, of course.

item.title: I look just like Buddy Holly
item.description: I went to the optometrist today and ordered new glasses, similar to the ones pictured here (but not quite as extreme). My eyes were proclaimed healthy and they have only slightly degraded over the past 4 years (the last time I saw the optometrist).

item.title: Sunshine II
item.description: It is forecasted that we will have a week of sunshine in Portland. Spring is near.

item.title: Pink Monkey
item.description: I have acquired two pink monkeys, one of which laughs hysterically. See comment for more info.

item.title: Stacy’s
item.description: Stacy’s Pita Chips are the best chips that I have ever tasted. I particularly like the Parmesan, Garlic & Herb and the Pesto & Sundried Tomato.

item.title: Sunshine
item.description: Sunshine milk is the best milk that I have ever tasted, and I am a milk connoisseur.
